column4: is ubuntu's "wine" package the most up to date, or do i need to build it from source?
winehq provides its own repos with the latest build
are you sure it isnt integrated already?
have you enabled third party repos?
then they might not authenticate themselves. just disregard that error message
But its not updating
you are updated. run 'sudo apt-get update' and youll see
Every time i do that it runs through a TON of wine files, then stops and says it cant proceed because no public key is available
yes, and i told you to dissregard that message and just run apt-get install win
wine is wine. that _is_ the compatibility layer
you mightwant to take a peek at cedega
You pay monthly for that right?
yes
the best way is a dualboot imho...
but then i have to use... nnf... winblows
true. no pain, no gain ;)
you dont even need that. all you need is elf binaries instead of coff ones
really? Then why dont they, its so effortless
epic, fex, include them on their install cd:s
couse they are stupid end evil :)
Corperations for you
so has epic and id
thats way over the top :)
